instruction: Who are you?
output: I am a dedicated customer service model developed by Comm100, committed to providing you with information, answering questions, and assisting with work or learning! How can I help you today? ðŸ˜„

instruction: Can you provide examples of regular expressions used for searching specific patterns in emails?
output: Yes, examples include: 1) Searching for an order with the pattern 'order id:[0-9]+'; 2) Searching for a report with the pattern 'report id salesforce_[0-9]+'; 3) Searching for an invoice with the pattern 'item_type:|electronics|mobile'.

instruction: How do I implement live chat in my app without relying on native frameworks?
output: If your app framework is not iOS or Android Native, such as Hybrid and React Native, you can implement the live chat window into the app using the WKWebView (for an iOS app) or WebView (for an Android app) solution. For React Native apps, you need to install the React Native WebView component, import WebView into your component, and load the chat window in your app.

instruction: What are the key steps to configure Auto Distribution in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To configure Auto Distribution, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Settings > Auto Distribution, turn on the Auto Distribution toggle key, set the distribution rules based on your Live Chat package (Startup, Plus, or Ultra), and click Save.

instruction: Can you explain how to export a voice bot using Comm100?
output: To export a voice bot in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Voice Bot in the left navigation menu, expand the voice bot drop-down list, click Manage in the Manage Voice Bots area, locate the target voice bot, click the more icon in the Operations column, and choose Voice Bot Export. The voice bot data is saved in an XML file on your local file system.

instruction: What steps are involved in setting up triggers in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To set up triggers, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Triggers, click New Triggers, fill in the Name and Description, turn on the Enable toggle key, select an event from the Event drop-down menu, define conditions for the trigger, set the action for the trigger, and click Save.

instruction: What are Comm100 Reports used for?
output: Comm100 provides robust reports focusing on data and metrics that matter most to chat quality, agent performance, visitor satisfaction, Chatbot performance, and Ticketing & Messaging performance to help make informed decisions for improvement.

instruction: What are the steps to set up an SMS Outreach Campaign?
output: To create an SMS outreach campaign, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Outreach Management > Outreach Campaigns, click New Outreach Campaign, and choose SMS. Complete the campaign settings, including the campaign name, target recipient filters, message content, and SMS channel account. Optionally, attach the message to a ticket. Save and preview the message, test the campaign if needed, and then schedule or send the campaign.

instruction: In what ways can webhooks be utilized within Comm100 Task Bot?
output: Comm100 Task Bot allows you to send and receive data to an external server or third-party services like Salesforce, Zendesk, Zapier, etc., using Webhook. By using the HTTP POST method, Task Bot Webhook can perform RESTful operations as per your business needs.

instruction: How can I add live chat to my app if it doesn't utilize native frameworks?
output: If your app framework is not iOS or Android Native, such as Hybrid and React Native, you can implement the live chat window into the app using the WKWebView (for an iOS app) or WebView (for an Android app) solution. For React Native apps, you need to install the React Native WebView component, import WebView into your component, and load the chat window in your app.

instruction: What is causing offline messages to not appear in my email inbox?
output: Agents are not getting offline messages in their email inbox. Potential causes include: the email address specified in Comm100 is different from the email inbox you are checking, incorrect format for multiple email addresses, and messages not enabled for the right Campaign. The solution involves logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to the Live Chat tab, selecting the correct Campaign in the Offline Message tab, ensuring the email address is correct, and adding one email entry per line for multiple recipients. If the issue persists, contact your email service provider or ISP for further testing and analysis.

instruction: How come offline messages are not reaching my email inbox?

instruction: What are the steps to install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Corecommerce Dashboard. 2. Click the Design menu on the left, then select Edit HTML/CSS. 3. Choose footer.html or header.html in the drop-down list under Edit HTML/CSS to install live chat on every page. 4. Get Live Chat Code and paste it before the closing tag. 5. Click Publish All to save the changes.

instruction: How are business days defined and utilized within the ticketing system?
output: Business days are the days when your team is working, and they are used to count days within trigger rules. Non-selected days will be skipped when rules are calculated.

instruction: In Comm100 Live Chat, how can chat requests be assigned automatically?
output: Chat requests can be distributed to agents automatically using Comm100's auto distribution feature. This can be configured in the Comm100 Control Panel under Live Chat > Settings > Auto Distribution.

instruction: Can you list the key datasets that are included in the Bot metrics and attributes?
output: The main datasets included in the Bot metrics and attributes are Chatbot Intent Detection Record and Task Bot Trigger Record.

instruction: What function do Comm100 Reports serve?
output: Comm100 provides robust reports focusing on data and metrics that matter most to chat quality, agent performance, visitor satisfaction, Chatbot performance, and Ticketing & Messaging performance to help make informed decisions for improvement.

instruction: How do I use Comm100's Social Media Integration to tag my social media conversations?
output: To add tags to your social media conversations using Comm100's Social Media Integration, log in to your Comm100 Agent Console, click the Ticketing & Messaging tab, select a conversation, click the Add link, choose existing tags or create new ones, and click OK to confirm. You can manage tags by clicking the Manage Tags icon.

instruction: How do you configure SAML SSO for agents to sign into Comm100?
output: To enable SAML SSO for agents to log into Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > Security > Agent Single Sign-On, turn on the Agent Single Sign-On (SSO) toggle key, switch to SAML SSO, fill in the required information such as Remote Login URL, Remote Logout URL, and the SAML certificate, and then click Save.

instruction: How can I ensure that visitor names are displayed instead of IP addresses in the Agent Console?
output: To ensure that visitor names are displayed, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select the correct campaign, go to Pre-chat and turn on the toggle key. Select the fields you want your visitors to fill in and mark them visible and required. Make sure to use the system default Name field and configure any custom variables correctly.

instruction: What are the steps to configure intents for a chatbot?
output: To set up intents for a chatbot, you need to log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbots, select a chatbot, go to Intents, and click 'New Intent.' Then, you name the intent, select or create a category, input the questions, and provide the answers.

instruction: Can you guide me on how to install Comm100 Live Chat on my Shopsite store?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to your Shopsite store, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Shopsite account. 2. Hover over Preferences and select Layout Settings. 3. Get the live chat code and paste it at the bottom of the Footer section. 4. Click Save Changes at the bottom of the page. 5. Click Publish Changes to apply the code, and you will see the chat button when you view the store.

instruction: What are the steps to set up conditions in a Comm100 chatbot?
output: To configure a Condition in a Comm100 chatbot, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot, select a bot, and go to Intents. Choose an existing Intent or create a new one, then drag the Conditions card and link it with the Collect variable data. Click Add Condition to open the New Condition drawer, set up conditions based on your needs, and click Save. Once conditions are configured, link other action cards with the branch in the chatbot workflow and click Save & Leave.

instruction: What can be achieved once Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging is integrated with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: After integrating Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging with Comm100 Live Chat, you can convert offline messages and chat transcripts into tickets directly, allowing you to track and follow up chats and offline messages in the Ticket module of your Agent Console.

instruction: How can Comm100 Live Chat be integrated with Cisco Finesse?

instruction: How can you export a chatbot in Comm100?
output: To export a chatbot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. In the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. 3. Click the drop-down list and go to the Manage chatbots area. 4. Click Manage. 5. Click Export Bot for the chatbot you want to export. The data is saved in an XML file on your local file system.

instruction: How can I fix the 'Email or Password Is Wrong' error message when signing into Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To resolve the error, ensure you are using the correct email and password, log in from the correct website address, use the correct Agent Console App, and if your live chat system is hosted on a cloud server, use the provided login links. If the system is deployed on your own server, use the dedicated login link with your specified domain.

instruction: What are some common use cases for triggers in a ticketing system?
output: Triggers are used to send out emails and notifications both internally to a department or agent, and to customers. Common use cases include sending acknowledgment emails to customers, notifying teams of ticket status changes, and handling tickets from VIP customers.

instruction: What are some frequent error messages you might come across while using Comm100 Secure Messaging?
output: Some common error messages include 'Feature is not available', 'Request is invalid', 'Channel is disabled', 'Invalid token provided', 'Contact Service is temporarily unavailable', and 'Access token service is temporarily unavailable'.

instruction: What steps can I take to have chat transcripts sent to my email inbox?
output: To ensure chat transcripts are delivered to your email inbox: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Navigate to Live Chat > Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the Campaign drop-down list. 4. Navigate to Chat Window > Advanced. 5. Make sure the email address is correct and check for typos. 6. If you have multiple recipients, separate them by commas. 7. If Agent Wrap-Up is required, the transcript will be sent when the wrap-up form is completed or 1 hour after the chat ends, whichever comes first.

instruction: What are the fundamental elements of a regular expression?
output: The basic components of a regular expression include character classes, special characters, and quantifiers. Character classes match specific sets of characters, special characters expand the use of regex, and quantifiers specify how many instances of a character or group to match.

output: Tom Cruise's mother is Mary Lee Pfeiffer.

instruction: Could you provide a concise introduction to Comm100?
output: Comm100 is a global leader in customer communication software, headquartered in Vancouver, Canada. In 2010, Comm100 officially entered the Chinese market. The company's products include an email marketing platform, live chat, and customer intelligence solutions. Comm100 has over 200,000 registered business users worldwide, including companies such as Intel, Volkswagen, NetEase Impressionist, BYD, CCTV Shopping Channel, and Wowo Group.

instruction: Where can you locate your API Key for Comm100 Live Chat API?
output: To find your API Key, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, hover over the avatar and click the agent name at the bottom-left of your navigation menu, expand the More Information section, and check your API Key at the bottom of the My Profile page.

instruction: What is the process to enable Auto Translation for a Comm100 chatbot?
output: To enable Auto Translation for a Comm100 chatbot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Go to Bot > Chatbot, expand the chatbot list, and click Manage. 3. In the chatbot list, locate the chatbot you want to enable the feature for, and click the Edit button in the Operations column. 4. Expand the Advanced section, and turn on the Auto Translation toggle key. 5. (Optional) To configure words and phrases that do not need translation, click the 'Click here' link in the Auto Translation area and add the words or phrases on the Auto Translation page.

instruction: Can you outline the process for integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Cisco Finesse?
output: The main steps include logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, enabling the Cisco Unified Contact Center App, providing server details, mapping Comm100 agents with Cisco agents, downloading and installing the Comm100 Gadget, configuring the Finesse desktop, and managing agent statuses.

instruction: Can you explain how an agent can reassign an ongoing chat to a different department in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to a department, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Department' option. 3. From the department list, select the department you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to one available agent in that department depending on the Auto Distribution Method.

instruction: Can a web page contain multiple chat buttons?
output: Yes. You can put multiple chat buttons on the same web page. Comm100 provides a specified code for extra chat buttons. If you want to install an extra chat button on the web page where one or more chat buttons are already being used, you need to get the specified code for the extra chat button.

instruction: What authentication options are provided for accessing the Comm100 API?
output: Comm100 allows you to access its APIs via API Key Authentication and OAuth Authentication.

instruction: What causes the 'Email or Password Is Wrong' error when I try to log into Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The error can occur due to several reasons: an incorrect email or password has been entered, signing into the Control Panel from an incorrect website address, trying to log in to the Agent Console with an incorrect App, or the account no longer exists.

instruction: What are the predefined roles in the Comm100 system?
output: The default roles in the Comm100 system are Administrators and Agents. Administrators have all the permissions, while Agents have basic permissions such as accepting chats.

instruction: Could you describe the Auto Translation feature in the Comm100 chatbot and its working mechanism?
output: Comm100 chatbot supports Auto Translation based on Google Translation integration. Auto Translation enables the bot to chat with visitors using any language by detecting the visitor's language and translating messages automatically. The chatbot sends responses in the language used by the visitor in the latest message, and visitors can see both the original and translated messages in the chat window.

instruction: What are the benefits of exporting and importing a chatbot in Comm100?
output: The prime benefits of exporting and importing a chatbot are: 1. Back-Up: You can take a backup of existing chatbots to use later in case of data loss or reuse. 2. Reuse the Chatbot: You can transfer an existing chatbot to another Comm100 account or campaign.

instruction: Can you explain the steps to remove the chat button on mobile sites using custom JavaScript?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window. 3. Expand the Advanced menu. 4. Select the 'Add custom JavaScript to my chat window' option under the Advanced menu and add the provided code. 5. Click Save. The Live Chat button will disappear from your mobile websites after the settings are successfully saved.

instruction: What format can be used with Task Bot Webhooks?
output: Task Bot Webhooks do not accept XML format. Only the JSON format is supported.

instruction: What might be the reason for chat transcripts not being sent to my email inbox?
output: The chat transcripts are not being delivered to your email inbox even if you have the 'Automatically email chat transcripts for archiving or follow-up' check box selected. Possible causes include: the email address specified in Comm100 is different from the email inbox you are checking, incorrect format for multiple email addresses, transcripts not enabled for the right campaign, or agents have not completed the wrap-up fields.

instruction: How do you set up Skill-Based Routing (SBR) in the Comm100 system?
output: To set up Skill-Based Routing (SBR) in the Comm100 system, you need to create skill types based on your business needs, assign these skills to agents, and then create routing rules to direct visitors to agents with matching skills. This involves logging into the Comm100 control panel, navigating to Global Settings > People > Skills to create skills, and then setting up routing rules under Live Chat > Campaign > Routing Rules.

instruction: How do you integrate Comm100 Live Chat into a website that is built using the Webs platform?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat onto a website built on the Webs platform, sign in to your account at www.webs.com, go to the Builder option, click the Other option in the bottom bar, drag the Custom HTML frame into your website content, paste your live chat code into the HTML content section, and save the changes. Finally, publish your website to check out the chat button.

instruction: Can you provide some guidelines for naming a chatbot?
output: When creating a chatbot, ensure the bot name is short and simple, easy to pronounce and spell, creative and memorable, without negative connotations, in line with your brand, and culturally and politically acceptable.

instruction: What solutions are available for the issue of not being able to send WhatsApp messages from Comm100?
output: To solve this issue, you need to add an Area Code to the outgoing WhatsApp number. You can do this by logging into your Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > WhatsApp, and editing the phone number to include the Area Code in the Phone number field. Save the changes, and the Area Code will be successfully added to the connected WhatsApp Business account.

instruction: What are the primary benefits of using Comm100 in conjunction with Salesforce?
output: Comm100's integration with Salesforce allows you to access customer information in the Comm100 Agent Console easily and synchronize data conveniently from Comm100 to Salesforce. The integration delivers a consistent customer information management experience and improves your agent efficiency.

instruction: How can the operating hours and holidays feature be configured in the ticketing and messaging system?
output: To configure the operating hours and holidays feature, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Operating Hours & Holidays. On the Operating Hours tab, select the checkboxes for the days your customer service team is working and select your working hours. On the Holidays tab, click the New Holiday button to set your holidays. You can also edit or remove an existing holiday from the Operations column. Finally, click Save.

instruction: How do you design quick replies for a chatbot?
output: To create quick replies for a chatbot, follow these steps: Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. In the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. Select your Chatbot from the drop-down list. Go to Event Messages. On the Event Messages page, click the Pencil icon beside the Message when a visitor starts a chat. On the Edit Message page, select the channel. From the Actions section, drag the Send quick reply and click the Plus icon to input the option text. Link each option to an Intent from your intent library. Click Save.

instruction: What should you refrain from doing when embedding the live chat code in the HTML Source Editor?
output: You should not change the live chat code when pasting it into the HTML Source Editor.

instruction: What is the process for setting up routing rules in Comm100?

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on my OpenCart website?

instruction: What can I do to make sure my chat button is online after I have installed Live Chat?
output: To make your chat button show as online, log in to the Agent Console with an online status. instruction: What is meant by intents when discussing chatbots?
output: Intents represent the intentions of a website visitor, such as 'Booking a ticket,' 'Paying a fee,' or 'Finding a news article.' They are contained in the questions that visitors ask to chatbots.

instruction: What are the necessary steps to import chatbot intents?
output: The requirements for importing chatbot intents include supported file formats (XLS, XLSX, CSV), a maximum file size of 1MB, a maximum of 1000 intents, intent names must be less than 50 characters, category definition using a single slash for the root category path, multiple question variations for the same intent separated by a vertical bar, and non-empty responses that can only be text or URL.

output: To find the Telnyx API Key and Phone Number, log in to your Telnyx account, go to 'API Keys' from the left navigation menu, copy the API Key to the clipboard, then go to 'Numbers' from the left navigation menu, locate the Telnyx Phone number in the list, and copy the number to the clipboard.

instruction: What is Auto Translation for Comm100 chatbot and how does it work?
output: Comm100 chatbot supports Auto Translation based on Google Translation integration. Auto Translation enables the bot to chat with visitors using any language by detecting the visitor's language and translating messages automatically. The chatbot sends responses in the language used by the visitor in the latest message, and visitors can see both the original and translated messages in the chat window.

instruction: Can you tell me the format supported by Task Bot Webhooks?
output: Task Bot Webhooks do not accept XML format. Only the JSON format is supported.

instruction: What can I do to make sure the Agent Console shows visitor names in place of IP addresses?
output: To ensure that visitor names are displayed, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select the correct campaign, go to Pre-chat and turn on the toggle key. Select the fields you want your visitors to fill in and mark them visible and required. Make sure to use the system default Name field and configure any custom variables correctly.

instruction: Why am I seeing the 'Email or Password Is Wrong' message when attempting to log into Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The error can occur due to several reasons: an incorrect email or password has been entered, signing into the Control Panel from an incorrect website address, trying to log in to the Agent Console with an incorrect App, or the account no longer exists.

instruction: Can you guide me on how to set up Comm100 Live Chat on my OpenCart website?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on your OpenCart website, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Admin login page and log in. 2. Click the System module and choose Settings. 3. Click Edit in the Action column. 4. Choose Server and scroll down the page to the end. 5. Paste the code in the Google Analytics Code area. 6. Click Save on the top right of your page. Now, you can see the chat button on your website.

instruction: How can you set up a login form with Facebook in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a login form with Facebook, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the drop-down list and go to Pre-Chat. 4. Turn on the Facebook login toggle key. 5. Click Save.

instruction: How do I configure the Agent Console to display visitor names instead of their IP addresses?
output: To ensure that visitor names are displayed, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select the correct campaign, go to Pre-chat and turn on the toggle key. Select the fields you want your visitors to fill in and mark them visible and required. Make sure to use the system default Name field and configure any custom variables correctly.

instruction: Are you able to add several chat buttons to the same web page?
output: Yes. You can put multiple chat buttons on the same web page. Comm100 provides a specified code for extra chat buttons. If you want to install an extra chat button on the web page where one or more chat buttons are already being used, you need to get the specified code for the extra chat button.

instruction: Can you tell me how to acquire the code for extra chat buttons?
output: To get the code for extra chat buttons, you first need to enable the Multiple Campaigns feature. Then, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, ensure that the campaign you want to use is selected from the Campaign drop-down list, and then click Installation. Click Advanced, and the code for the extra chat buttons will appear. Copy the code and paste it onto your webpage. If you need any help, please contact our support team.

instruction: What positive outcomes result from presenting agents' titles and bios in the chat window?
output: Displaying agents' title and bio in the chat window provides a quick overview of agents' job responsibilities, level of job, experience, or expertise, which helps deliver a better customer experience when they are chatting with your agents.

instruction: What is the process for integrating Comm100 Live Chat into my Shopsite store?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to your Shopsite store, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Shopsite account. 2. Hover over Preferences and select Layout Settings. 3. Get the live chat code and paste it at the bottom of the Footer section. 4. Click Save Changes at the bottom of the page. 5. Click Publish Changes to apply the code, and you will see the chat button when you view the store.

instruction: Can you explain what an Outreach Campaign is?
output: Comm100 Outreach is a messaging system that allows organizations to reach out to their customers on a mass level. It enables the delivery of emails, SMS, and WhatsApp messages to targeted customer groups in an automated and personalized way, combining the benefits of the Comm100 ticketing system for efficient follow-up.

instruction: What are the main datasets included in the Bot metrics and attributes?
output: The main datasets included in the Bot metrics and attributes are Chatbot Intent Detection Record and Task Bot Trigger Record.

instruction: Can you guide me on how to set up Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Corecommerce Dashboard. 2. Click the Design menu on the left, then select Edit HTML/CSS. 3. Choose footer.html or header.html in the drop-down list under Edit HTML/CSS to install live chat on every page. 4. Get Live Chat Code and paste it before the closing tag. 5. Click Publish All to save the changes.

instruction: How can I switch on JavaScript in the Google Chrome browser?
output: To enable JavaScript in Google Chrome, click the wrench icon to the right of the address bar, select Settings from the dropdown list, scroll down the page and click Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: How do I address the problem of not being able to send WhatsApp messages via Comm100?
output: To solve this issue, you need to add an Area Code to the outgoing WhatsApp number. You can do this by logging into your Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > WhatsApp, and editing the phone number to include the Area Code in the Phone number field. Save the changes, and the Area Code will be successfully added to the connected WhatsApp Business account.

instruction: What attributes are contained within the Agent Status Log Dataset?
output: The attributes included in the Agent Status Log Dataset are 'Agent', 'Department', and 'Time'.

instruction: How can routing rules be configured in the Comm100 system?
output: To create routing rules in the Comm100 system, log in to the Comm100 control panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Routing Rules, and turn on the Enable toggle key. Select the 'Route visitors based on custom rules' option and click 'New Rule' to create a new rule. Enter a unique rule name, enable the rule, add conditions, set the department or agent to route visitors to, set the priority, and click OK. Finally, save the routing rule.

instruction: How do visitors benefit from the integration of Comm100 Live Chat with Facebook?
output: Visitors can click the Facebook icon in the Pre-Chat window to sign in without filling out the pre-chat form. If a visitor initiates a chat by signing in with a social media account, their information (Avatar, Name, Email, and more) will be automatically displayed in the Visitor monitor.

instruction: How does an agent move an ongoing conversation to another available agent using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to an online agent, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Agent' option. 3. From the drop-down list, select an online agent you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to the online agent.

instruction: Which format does Task Bot Webhooks support?
output: Task Bot Webhooks do not accept XML format. Only the JSON format is supported.

instruction: Why are the adjustments I implement in Comm100 not being reflected on my website?
output: The possible causes could be: having more than one campaign and not making changes to the right one, not saving the changes, or not refreshing/reloading the webpage after saving the changes. To resolve this, ensure you are customizing the right campaign, save the changes, and refresh your webpage.

instruction: How come I am unable to send WhatsApp messages after connecting my account with Comm100?
output: After integrating your WhatsApp account with Comm100, you may be unable to send messages because Twilio doesn't automatically add the required Area Code to the WhatsApp number when shared with Comm100. As a result, the outgoing messages from Comm100 fail to reach the customer.

instruction: Can you explain how to set up a Facebook login form in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a login form with Facebook, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the drop-down list and go to Pre-Chat. 4. Turn on the Facebook login toggle key. 5. Click Save.

instruction: Can you explain how to obtain your API Key for Comm100 Live Chat API?
output: To find your API Key, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, hover over the avatar and click the agent name at the bottom-left of your navigation menu, expand the More Information section, and check your API Key at the bottom of the My Profile page.

instruction: What benefits can be gained from exporting and importing a chatbot in Comm100?
output: The prime benefits of exporting and importing a chatbot are: 1. Back-Up: You can take a backup of existing chatbots to use later in case of data loss or reuse. 2. Reuse the Chatbot: You can transfer an existing chatbot to another Comm100 account or campaign.

instruction: Can you list the essential properties contained in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data?
output: Key properties in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data include the visitor's information (such as name, email, city, country, browser, and operating system) and the offline message details (such as content, department, and time of submission).

instruction: Why am I seeing IP addresses instead of visitor names in the Agent Console?
output: You are seeing IP addresses instead of visitor names because the pre-chat window is not enabled, the Name field is either invisible or not set as required, you are using a custom pre-chat field instead of the system default Name field, or the configuration for custom variables to automatically get the name data has not been properly done.

instruction: How do you go about creating an SMS Outreach Campaign?
output: To create an SMS outreach campaign, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Outreach Management > Outreach Campaigns, click New Outreach Campaign, and choose SMS. Complete the campaign settings, including the campaign name, target recipient filters, message content, and SMS channel account. Optionally, attach the message to a ticket. Save and preview the message, test the campaign if needed, and then schedule or send the campaign.

instruction: What are the metrics that are included in the Canned Message Usage Dataset?

instruction: Can you explain what intents are in relation to chatbots?

instruction: How do you implement Comm100 Live Chat on an Ansak Stores site?

instruction: What is the process for configuring agent roles in the Comm100 system?

instruction: What might be the reason for the 'Email or Password Is Wrong' error when logging into Comm100 Live Chat?

instruction: Can you show examples of regular expressions that search for particular patterns in emails?

instruction: How can you enable Auto Translation for a Comm100 chatbot?

instruction: What information do I need to enable SAML Single Sign-On in Comm100?
output: To enable SAML SSO in Comm100, you need the remote login URL for your SAML, the remote logout URL (optional), and the SAML certificate from your SAML server. X.509 certificates are supported and should be in PEM or DER format.

instruction: How can Skill-Based Routing (SBR) be set up in the Comm100 system?

instruction: What must be done before an agent can begin accepting chats on Comm100 Live Chat?

instruction: How can I ensure chat transcripts are delivered to my email inbox?
output: To ensure chat transcripts are delivered to your email inbox: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Navigate to Live Chat > Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the Campaign drop-down list. 4. Navigate to Chat Window > Advanced. 5. Make sure the email address is correct and check for typos. 6. If you have multiple recipients, separate them by commas. 7. If Agent Wrap-Up is required, the transcript will be sent when the wrap-up form is completed or 1 hour after the chat ends, whichever comes first.

instruction: What happens if 'Replace' is enabled during the import of chatbot intents?
output: If 'Replace' is enabled, the importing action will overwrite all existing intents. If not enabled, intents with different names from existing ones will be imported as new ones, and if the intent name is the same but the visitor's questions are different, the questions will be imported into the corresponding intent.

instruction: What are the key advantages of combining Comm100 with Salesforce?

The integration delivers a consistent customer information management experience and improves your agent efficiency.

instruction: How can I turn off Auto Invitations on mobile-friendly websites using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To disable Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites using Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Integrations & API > Custom Variables. 3. Click Settings. 4. Click New Custom Variable. 5. Define the Variable Name of your choice (e.g., 'From Mobile'). 6. From the Type drop-down list, select Text. 7. In the Value field, provide: /mobile|android|ipad/.test(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) ? 'Yes' : 'No'. 8. In the Hyperlink field, add a hyperlink to the value of a custom variable. 9. Click Save. 10. Now, from the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Invitation. 11. From the Auto Invitations tab, select the auto invitation that you wish to disable on mobile-optimized websites. 12. Under the Conditions area, add a condition using the Custom Variable as 'From Mobile is No'. 13. Click Save. The configuration is now complete, and your Live Chat will not send Auto Invitations when visitors access your websites via mobile devices.

instruction: What is the method to link Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging System with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To integrate Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging System with Comm100 Live Chat, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Apps & Integration from the left navigation menu, click Settings of the Ticketing & Messages Integration tile, turn on the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Integration toggle key, and click Save.

instruction: What could be the reason for offline messages not being delivered to my email inbox?
output: Agents are not getting offline messages in their email inbox. Potential causes include: the email address specified in Comm100 is different from the email inbox you are checking, incorrect format for multiple email addresses, and messages not enabled for the right Campaign. The solution involves logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to the Live Chat tab, selecting the correct Campaign in the Offline Message tab, ensuring the email address is correct, and adding one email entry per line for multiple recipients. If the issue persists, contact your email service provider or ISP for further testing and analysis.

instruction: How can a voice bot be imported into Comm100?
output: To import a voice bot in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Voice Bot in the left navigation menu, expand the voice bot drop-down list, click Manage in the Manage Voice Bots area, locate the target voice bot, click the more icon in the Operations column, and choose Voice Bot Import. Upload the XML file and click Import. All configurations and data excluding Channel settings and call logs are replaced by the new bot after importing succeeds.

instruction: What are the steps to add live chat functionality to my iOS or Android app using native frameworks?
output: To integrate live chat into your iOS app using the native framework, you need to form the chat URL with your site ID and campaign ID, import VisitorClient.framework into your iOS project, and set the response to the chat button touch event. For Android apps, you need to import visitor-client-v1.1.aar into your Android project and call the buttonâ€™s instance method setOnClickListener to show ChatActivity.

instruction: What steps are required to add Comm100 Live Chat to an Ansak Stores site?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to an Ansak Stores site, log in to the Administration Panel, click Page Management, add a new page, input the Title and Extended Header, click the HTML icon, paste the live chat code into the HTML Source Editor, click Update, and save the newly created page. The Comm100 Live Chat button will then appear on your Ansak Store site.

instruction: What information is required to enable SAML SSO in Comm100?
output: To enable SAML SSO in Comm100, you need the remote login URL for your SAML, the remote logout URL (optional), and the SAML certificate from your SAML server. X.509 certificates are supported and should be in PEM or DER format.

instruction: What is the procedure to enable JavaScript in Chrome?
output: To enable JavaScript in Google Chrome, click the wrench icon to the right of the address bar, select Settings from the dropdown list, scroll down the page and click Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: Can you list the default roles available in the Comm100 system?
output: The default roles in the Comm100 system are Administrators and Agents. Administrators have all the permissions, while Agents have basic permissions such as accepting chats.

instruction: Can you list some common error messages that occur when using Comm100 Secure Messaging?
output: Some common error messages include 'Feature is not available', 'Request is invalid', 'Channel is disabled', 'Invalid token provided', 'Contact Service is temporarily unavailable', and 'Access token service is temporarily unavailable'.

instruction: What is the reason the modifications I make in Comm100 are not visible on my website?
output: The possible causes could be: having more than one campaign and not making changes to the right one, not saving the changes, or not refreshing/reloading the webpage after saving the changes. To resolve this, ensure you are customizing the right campaign, save the changes, and refresh your webpage.

instruction: What will occur if 'Replace' is activated during the import of chatbot intents?
output: If 'Replace' is enabled, the importing action will overwrite all existing intents. If not enabled, intents with different names from existing ones will be imported as new ones, and if the intent name is the same but the visitor's questions are different, the questions will be imported into the corresponding intent.

instruction: Which key metrics are associated with the Chatbot Intent Detection Record dataset?
output: Some of the key metrics for the Chatbot Intent Detection Record dataset include Answers, Helpful Rate, High Confidence Answers, % of High Confidence Answers, No Answers, No Rate, Not Helpful Rate, and Possible Answers.

instruction: What is the procedure for setting up Auto Distribution in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To configure Auto Distribution, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Settings > Auto Distribution, turn on the Auto Distribution toggle key, set the distribution rules based on your Live Chat package (Startup, Plus, or Ultra), and click Save.

instruction: What are the steps to turn on JavaScript in Google Chrome?
output: To enable JavaScript in Google Chrome, click the wrench icon to the right of the address bar, select Settings from the dropdown list, scroll down the page and click Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: What are the steps to integrate Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging System with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To integrate Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging System with Comm100 Live Chat, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Apps & Integration from the left navigation menu, click Settings of the Ticketing & Messages Integration tile, turn on the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Integration toggle key, and click Save.

instruction: How does an agent initiate the process of accepting chats in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To start accepting chats, an agent needs to: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Go to Live Chat > Get Online & Chat from the left navigation menu. 3. In the Visitors tab, view the visitors browsing the website. 4. Click the Details link in the Visitor tab to see detailed information. 5. Open the website with the live chat code and click the chat button to initiate a chat request. 6. Accept the chat request in the Live Chat tab of the Agent Console. 7. Communicate with the visitor by sending and receiving messages. 8. Categorize and add notes to each chat in the Wrap-up panel during or after the chat session.

instruction: How do I disable Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To disable Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites using Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Integrations & API > Custom Variables. 3. Click Settings. 4. Click New Custom Variable. 5. Define the Variable Name of your choice (e.g., 'From Mobile'). 6. From the Type drop-down list, select Text. 7. In the Value field, provide: /mobile|android|ipad/.test(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) ? 'Yes' : 'No'. 8. In the Hyperlink field, add a hyperlink to the value of a custom variable. 9. Click Save. 10. Now, from the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Invitation. 11. From the Auto Invitations tab, select the auto invitation that you wish to disable on mobile-optimized websites. 12. Under the Conditions area, add a condition using the Custom Variable as 'From Mobile is No'. 13. Click Save. The configuration is now complete, and your Live Chat will not send Auto Invitations when visitors access your websites via mobile devices.

instruction: What is the process for setting up a login form with Facebook in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a login form with Facebook, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the drop-down list and go to Pre-Chat. 4. Turn on the Facebook login toggle key. 5. Click Save.

instruction: What are the main steps to integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Cisco Finesse?
output: The main steps include logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, enabling the Cisco Unified Contact Center App, providing server details, mapping Comm100 agents with Cisco agents, downloading and installing the Comm100 Gadget, configuring the Finesse desktop, and managing agent statuses.

instruction: Can you explain how to establish intents for a chatbot?
output: To set up intents for a chatbot, you need to log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbots, select a chatbot, go to Intents, and click 'New Intent.' Then, you name the intent, select or create a category, input the questions, and provide the answers.

instruction: In the context of the ticketing system, what are business days and how are they applied?
output: Business days are the days when your team is working, and they are used to count days within trigger rules. Non-selected days will be skipped when rules are calculated.

instruction: What are the steps to add Comm100 Live Chat to my Weebly site?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on your Weebly website, log in to your Weebly account, locate your website and click the Edit button to open its admin panel. Find the EMBED CODE item in the left sidebar, drag it into your website content, paste your live chat code into the custom HTML frame, and publish your website. You should then see the chat button on your website.

instruction: What are the attributes included in the Agent Status Log Dataset?
output: The attributes included in the Agent Status Log Dataset are 'Agent', 'Department', and 'Time'.

instruction: What is the process for setting up field mappings in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To create field mappings, log in to Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Fields & Mappings, select the Mappings tab, click the pencil icon under the Operations column, choose the mapping field from the Chat field and/or Offline message field, and click Save. The system obtains the value for the Chat field or Offline message field depending on the channel of the ticket.

instruction: How can I reset an agent's password in my account?
output: To reset an agent's password, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > People > Agents, click the Reset Password icon in the Operations column, enter the new password and confirm it, then click Save.

instruction: What is the method to hide the Live Chat button on mobile websites when the site code is shared between desktop and mobile versions?
output: You can hide the Live Chat button on mobile websites by either adding custom JavaScript code to the Comm100 Live Chat code or by customizing the Mobile View of the Image type of chat button.

instruction: How do you configure the operating hours and holidays feature in the ticketing and messaging system?
output: To configure the operating hours and holidays feature, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Operating Hours & Holidays. On the Operating Hours tab, select the checkboxes for the days your customer service team is working and select your working hours. On the Holidays tab, click the New Holiday button to set your holidays. You can also edit or remove an existing holiday from the Operations column. Finally, click Save.

instruction: What are the steps to connect Comm100 with Salesforce CRM?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Apps & Integration. 3. Go to the Salesforce card, and click Settings. 4. Click Connect with Salesforce and then provide your Salesforce login credentials in the popup. Note: You need to have particular sets of permissions in your Salesforce account for the integration to work. It is recommended that you use an Admin SF account.

instruction: What are the steps to configure a Facebook login form in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a login form with Facebook, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the drop-down list and go to Pre-Chat. 4. Turn on the Facebook login toggle key. 5. Click Save.

instruction: What steps are involved in configuring the operating hours and holidays feature within the ticketing and messaging system?
output: To configure the operating hours and holidays feature, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Operating Hours & Holidays. On the Operating Hours tab, select the checkboxes for the days your customer service team is working and select your working hours. On the Holidays tab, click the New Holiday button to set your holidays. You can also edit or remove an existing holiday from the Operations column. Finally, click Save.

instruction: Why can't I send WhatsApp messages after integrating my account with Comm100?
output: After integrating your WhatsApp account with Comm100, you may be unable to send messages because Twilio doesn't automatically add the required Area Code to the WhatsApp number when shared with Comm100. As a result, the outgoing messages from Comm100 fail to reach the customer.

instruction: In what situations are triggers commonly utilized within a ticketing system?
output: Triggers are used to send out emails and notifications both internally to a department or agent, and to customers. Common use cases include sending acknowledgment emails to customers, notifying teams of ticket status changes, and handling tickets from VIP customers.

instruction: How can you add Comm100 Live Chat to an Ansak Stores site?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to an Ansak Stores site, log in to the Administration Panel, click Page Management, add a new page, input the Title and Extended Header, click the HTML icon, paste the live chat code into the HTML Source Editor, click Update, and save the newly created page. instruction: Can you explain how to implement Skill-Based Routing (SBR) in the Comm100 platform?
output: To set up Skill-Based Routing (SBR) in the Comm100 system, you need to create skill types based on your business needs, assign these skills to agents, and then create routing rules to direct visitors to agents with matching skills. This involves logging into the Comm100 control panel, navigating to Global Settings > People > Skills to create skills, and then setting up routing rules under Live Chat > Campaign > Routing Rules.

instruction: How can I get the code for extra chat buttons?
output: To get the code for extra chat buttons, you first need to enable the Multiple Campaigns feature. Then, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, ensure that the campaign you want to use is selected from the Campaign drop-down list, and then click Installation. Click Advanced, and the code for the extra chat buttons will appear. Copy the code and paste it onto your webpage. If you need any help, please contact our support team.

instruction: What are the requirements for importing chatbot intents?
output: The requirements for importing chatbot intents include supported file formats (XLS, XLSX, CSV), a maximum file size of 1MB, a maximum of 1000 intents, intent names must be less than 50 characters, category definition using a single slash for the root category path, multiple question variations for the same intent separated by a vertical bar, and non-empty responses that can only be text or URL.

instruction: How can I enable JavaScript in my web browser?
output: Enabling JavaScript is required for some of the Comm100 features to work. The instructions vary depending on the browser you are using. For example, in Google Chrome, you need to click the wrench icon, select Settings, scroll down to Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: What happens if the Telnyx API Key is inactive or deleted after configuring SMS integration?
output: If the Telnyx API Key is inactive or deleted after configuring SMS integration, you will still receive SMS messages but will not be able to send a reply. You will receive a failed authentication message for the API Key.

instruction: Why are routing rules used in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Routing rules dictate which department or agent is assigned a ticket when a customer reaches out and a new ticket is created. These rules ensure that tickets are immediately routed to the person best suited to handle the request.

instruction: Why do I get the error 'Email or Password Is Wrong' when trying to log into Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The error can occur due to several reasons: an incorrect email or password has been entered, signing into the Control Panel from an incorrect website address, trying to log in to the Agent Console with an incorrect App, or the account no longer exists.

instruction: Can you list the metrics found in the Canned Message Usage Dataset?
output: The metrics included in the Canned Message Usage Dataset are 'Used Agents' and 'Used Times'.

instruction: Is Arabic/Hebrew supported in Comm100 Live Chat?

instruction: What steps are required to add Comm100 Live Chat to my Shopsite store?

instruction: Can you explain how an agent can hand over a current chat to another online agent in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to an online agent, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Agent' option. 3. From the drop-down list, select an online agent you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to the online agent.

instruction: What are the significant benefits of merging Comm100 with Salesforce?
output: Comm100's integration with Salesforce allows you to access customer information in the Comm100 Agent Console easily and synchronize data conveniently from Comm100 to Salesforce. The integration delivers a consistent customer information management experience and improves your agent efficiency.

instruction: How can an agent transfer an ongoing chat to another department using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to a department, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Department' option. 3. From the department list, select the department you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to one available agent in that department depending on the Auto Distribution Method.

instruction: What are the positive aspects of exporting and importing a chatbot in Comm100?
output: The prime benefits of exporting and importing a chatbot are: 1. Back-Up: You can take a backup of existing chatbots to use later in case of data loss or reuse. 2. Reuse the Chatbot: You can transfer an existing chatbot to another Comm100 account or campaign.

instruction: Can you guide me on how to activate JavaScript in Google Chrome?
output: To enable JavaScript in Google Chrome, click the wrench icon to the right of the address bar, select Settings from the dropdown list, scroll down the page and click Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: What is the process for adding custom fields to tickets in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: With the Fields & Mappings feature of Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, you can create additional fields that help give context to a ticket. These fields allow you to capture information and save it to a ticket. You can create custom fields with various types such as Text, Text area, Email, URL, Link, Date, Phone, Integer, Float, Agent, Department, Radio button, Checkbox, Dropdown list, and Checkbox list. To create custom fields, log in to Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Fields & Mappings, click New Field, select a data type, provide field details, and click Save.

instruction: What steps should I follow to reset an agent's password in my account?
output: To reset an agent's password, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > People > Agents, click the Reset Password icon in the Operations column, enter the new password and confirm it, then click Save.

instruction: Can you explain how to set the operating hours and holidays in the ticketing and messaging system?
output: To configure the operating hours and holidays feature, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Operating Hours & Holidays. On the Operating Hours tab, select the checkboxes for the days your customer service team is working and select your working hours. On the Holidays tab, click the New Holiday button to set your holidays. You can also edit or remove an existing holiday from the Operations column. Finally, click Save.

instruction: Can you explain how to configure triggers in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To set up triggers, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Triggers, click New Triggers, fill in the Name and Description, turn on the Enable toggle key, select an event from the Event drop-down menu, define conditions for the trigger, set the action for the trigger, and click Save.

instruction: How can I integrate Comm100 with Salesforce CRM?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Apps & Integration. 3. Go to the Salesforce card, and click Settings. 4. Click Connect with Salesforce and then provide your Salesforce login credentials in the popup. Note: You need to have particular sets of permissions in your Salesforce account for the integration to work. It is recommended that you use an Admin SF account.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Corecommerce Dashboard. 2. Click the Design menu on the left, then select Edit HTML/CSS. 3. Choose footer.html or header.html in the drop-down list under Edit HTML/CSS to install live chat on every page. 4. Get Live Chat Code and paste it before the closing tag. 5. Click Publish All to save the changes.

instruction: What are the main attributes found in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data?
output: Key properties in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data include the visitor's information (such as name, email, city, country, browser, and operating system) and the offline message details (such as content, department, and time of submission).

instruction: How do I integrate Comm100 Live Chat with my OpenCart store?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on your OpenCart website, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Admin login page and log in. 2. Click the System module and choose Settings. 3. Click Edit in the Action column. 4. Choose Server and scroll down the page to the end. 5. Paste the code in the Google Analytics Code area. 6. Click Save on the top right of your page. Now, you can see the chat button on your website.

instruction: What are the visitor benefits of integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Facebook?
output: Visitors can click the Facebook icon in the Pre-Chat window to sign in without filling out the pre-chat form. If a visitor initiates a chat by signing in with a social media account, their information (Avatar, Name, Email, and more) will be automatically displayed in the Visitor monitor.

instruction: What is the process to find your API Key for Comm100 Live Chat API?
output: To find your API Key, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, hover over the avatar and click the agent name at the bottom-left of your navigation menu, expand the More Information section, and check your API Key at the bottom of the My Profile page.

instruction: What is the purpose of using tags in Comm100's Social Media Integration?
output: The purpose of using tags in Comm100's Social Media Integration is to organize social media queries by assigning keywords or phrases to conversations, making it easier to group and review messages later.

instruction: What are some key properties included in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data?
output: Key properties in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data include the visitor's information (such as name, email, city, country, browser, and operating system) and the offline message details (such as content, department, and time of submission).

instruction: What advantages come from showing agents' titles and bios in the chat window?
output: Displaying agents' title and bio in the chat window provides a quick overview of agents' job responsibilities, level of job, experience, or expertise, which helps deliver a better customer experience when they are chatting with your agents.

instruction: What is the purpose of routing rules in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Routing rules dictate which department or agent is assigned a ticket when a customer reaches out and a new ticket is created. These rules ensure that tickets are immediately routed to the person best suited to handle the request.

instruction: How can you configure conditions in a Comm100 chatbot?
output: To configure a Condition in a Comm100 chatbot, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot, select a bot, and go to Intents. Choose an existing Intent or create a new one, then drag the Conditions card and link it with the Collect variable data. Click Add Condition to open the New Condition drawer, set up conditions based on your needs, and click Save. Once conditions are configured, link other action cards with the branch in the chatbot workflow and click Save & Leave.

instruction: What steps are involved in importing a voice bot into Comm100?
output: To import a voice bot in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Voice Bot in the left navigation menu, expand the voice bot drop-down list, click Manage in the Manage Voice Bots area, locate the target voice bot, click the more icon in the Operations column, and choose Voice Bot Import. Upload the XML file and click Import. All configurations and data excluding Channel settings and call logs are replaced by the new bot after importing succeeds.

instruction: How do you set up routing rules in Comm100?
output: To configure routing rules in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Routing Rules, turn ON the toggle key, and follow the steps to assign tickets to specific departments or agents, or create custom rules based on various conditions.

instruction: Can you explain what business days are and their role in the ticketing system?
output: Business days are the days when your team is working, and they are used to count days within trigger rules. Non-selected days will be skipped when rules are calculated.

instruction: How can you configure routing rules in Comm100?
output: To configure routing rules in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Routing Rules, turn ON the toggle key, and follow the steps to assign tickets to specific departments or agents, or create custom rules based on various conditions.

instruction: What is the process for linking Comm100 to Salesforce CRM?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Apps & Integration. 3. Go to the Salesforce card, and click Settings. 4. Click Connect with Salesforce and then provide your Salesforce login credentials in the popup. Note: You need to have particular sets of permissions in your Salesforce account for the integration to work. It is recommended that you use an Admin SF account.

instruction: What are the steps to develop quick replies for a chatbot?
output: To create quick replies for a chatbot, follow these steps: Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. In the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. Select your Chatbot from the drop-down list. Go to Event Messages. On the Event Messages page, click the Pencil icon beside the Message when a visitor starts a chat. On the Edit Message page, select the channel. From the Actions section, drag the Send quick reply and click the Plus icon to input the option text. Link each option to an Intent from your intent library. Click Save.

instruction: What metrics does the Canned Message Usage Dataset contain?
output: The metrics included in the Canned Message Usage Dataset are 'Used Agents' and 'Used Times'.

instruction: How can an agent transfer an ongoing chat to another online agent using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to an online agent, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Agent' option. 3. From the drop-down list, select an online agent you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to the online agent.

instruction: How do I retrieve the Telnyx API Key and Phone Number for SMS integration with Comm100?
output: To find the Telnyx API Key and Phone Number, log in to your Telnyx account, go to 'API Keys' from the left navigation menu, copy the API Key to the clipboard, then go to 'Numbers' from the left navigation menu, locate the Telnyx Phone number in the list, and copy the number to the clipboard.

instruction: What can I do to receive chat transcripts in my email inbox?
output: To ensure chat transcripts are delivered to your email inbox: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Navigate to Live Chat > Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the Campaign drop-down list. 4. Navigate to Chat Window > Advanced. 5. Make sure the email address is correct and check for typos. 6. If you have multiple recipients, separate them by commas. 7. If Agent Wrap-Up is required, the transcript will be sent when the wrap-up form is completed or 1 hour after the chat ends, whichever comes first.

instruction: How come I am not receiving chat transcripts in my email inbox?
output: The chat transcripts are not being delivered to your email inbox even if you have the 'Automatically email chat transcripts for archiving or follow-up' check box selected. Possible causes include: the email address specified in Comm100 is different from the email inbox you are checking, incorrect format for multiple email addresses, transcripts not enabled for the right campaign, or agents have not completed the wrap-up fields.

instruction: Why is it beneficial to include agents' titles and bios in the chat window?
output: Displaying agents' title and bio in the chat window provides a quick overview of agents' job responsibilities, level of job, experience, or expertise, which helps deliver a better customer experience when they are chatting with your agents.

instruction: Why am I unable to send WhatsApp messages after merging my account with Comm100?
output: After integrating your WhatsApp account with Comm100, you may be unable to send messages because Twilio doesn't automatically add the required Area Code to the WhatsApp number when shared with Comm100. As a result, the outgoing messages from Comm100 fail to reach the customer.

instruction: Can you explain how to configure field mappings in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To create field mappings, log in to Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Fields & Mappings, select the Mappings tab, click the pencil icon under the Operations column, choose the mapping field from the Chat field and/or Offline message field, and click Save. The system obtains the value for the Chat field or Offline message field depending on the channel of the ticket.

instruction: What are the steps an agent needs to follow to start accepting chats in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To start accepting chats, an agent needs to: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Go to Live Chat > Get Online & Chat from the left navigation menu. 3. In the Visitors tab, view the visitors browsing the website. 4. Click the Details link in the Visitor tab to see detailed information. 5. Open the website with the live chat code and click the chat button to initiate a chat request. 6. Accept the chat request in the Live Chat tab of the Agent Console. 7. Communicate with the visitor by sending and receiving messages. 8. Categorize and add notes to each chat in the Wrap-up panel during or after the chat session.

instruction: What is the process to obtain the code for additional chat buttons?
output: To get the code for extra chat buttons, you first need to enable the Multiple Campaigns feature. Then, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, ensure that the campaign you want to use is selected from the Campaign drop-down list, and then click Installation. Click Advanced, and the code for the extra chat buttons will appear. Copy the code and paste it onto your webpage. If you need any help, please contact our support team.

instruction: How do I stop Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites through Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To disable Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites using Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Integrations & API > Custom Variables. 3. Click Settings. 4. Click New Custom Variable. 5. Define the Variable Name of your choice (e.g., 'From Mobile'). 6. From the Type drop-down list, select Text. 7. In the Value field, provide: /mobile|android|ipad/.test(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) ? 'Yes' : 'No'. 8. In the Hyperlink field, add a hyperlink to the value of a custom variable. 9. Click Save. 10. Now, from the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Invitation. 11. From the Auto Invitations tab, select the auto invitation that you wish to disable on mobile-optimized websites. 12. Under the Conditions area, add a condition using the Custom Variable as 'From Mobile is No'. 13. Click Save. The configuration is now complete, and your Live Chat will not send Auto Invitations when visitors access your websites via mobile devices.

instruction: How can the Live Chat button be hidden on mobile websites when the same code is used for both desktop and mobile versions?
output: You can hide the Live Chat button on mobile websites by either adding custom JavaScript code to the Comm100 Live Chat code or by customizing the Mobile View of the Image type of chat button.

instruction: Can you guide me on integrating live chat into my iOS or Android app using native development tools?

instruction: What are the requirements to activate SAML SSO in Comm100?
output: To enable SAML SSO in Comm100, you need the remote login URL for your SAML, the remote logout URL (optional), and the SAML certificate from your SAML server. X.509 certificates are supported and should be in PEM or DER format.

instruction: What is the process to export a voice bot in Comm100?

instruction: Why are IP addresses showing up instead of visitor names in the Agent Console?
output: You are seeing IP addresses instead of visitor names because the pre-chat window is not enabled, the Name field is either invisible or not set as required, you are using a custom pre-chat field instead of the system default Name field, or the configuration for custom variables to automatically get the name data has not been properly done.

instruction: Is it feasible to place multiple chat buttons on one web page?
output: Yes. You can put multiple chat buttons on the same web page. Comm100 provides a specified code for extra chat buttons. instruction: Can you explain how to set up Comm100 Live Chat on a website hosted on the Webs platform?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat onto a website built on the Webs platform, sign in to your account at www.webs.com, go to the Builder option, click the Other option in the bottom bar, drag the Custom HTML frame into your website content, paste your live chat code into the HTML content section, and save the changes. Finally, publish your website to check out the chat button.

instruction: How do you create routing rules in the Comm100 system?
output: To create routing rules in the Comm100 system, log in to the Comm100 control panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Routing Rules, and turn on the Enable toggle key. Select the 'Route visitors based on custom rules' option and click 'New Rule' to create a new rule. Enter a unique rule name, enable the rule, add conditions, set the department or agent to route visitors to, set the priority, and click OK. Finally, save the routing rule.

instruction: Can you list the essential parts of a regular expression?
output: The basic components of a regular expression include character classes, special characters, and quantifiers. Character classes match specific sets of characters, special characters expand the use of regex, and quantifiers specify how many instances of a character or group to match.

instruction: What are some standard uses for triggers in a ticketing system?
output: Triggers are used to send out emails and notifications both internally to a department or agent, and to customers. Common use cases include sending acknowledgment emails to customers, notifying teams of ticket status changes, and handling tickets from VIP customers.
